review.rating: Unhelpful scammy staff, broken toilets, sinks, showers.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i
review.comment_positive: The only pros of this hotel is that it is downtown and close to restaurants and the beach.
review.comment_negative: we had a horrible experience with the staff, bookings, and quality of the rooms and stay. The toilet in our room has a small hole at the base of it, so when you flush the toilet, it pushes out some of what was flushed on to the bathroom floor. We're on the 10th floor, and at 5 am they started doing maintenance or maybe vacuuming on the 11th floor. One of my friends was first assigned a room that smelled like someone smoked a chimney inside the room. Her replacement room does not have a working sink. Our other friends booked a luxury ocean view room, and upon check in, were told none were available. The staff tried to give them a much cheaper room while charging them the original price, which is almost double the price of the cheaper room. When booking through booking.com or Agoda, they never seem to communicate or organize enough to have the reserved rooms actually available when the customers check in. The last person in our group booked 4 rooms for his relatives, and was told they only had 2 available. Lastly, their currency exchange service is a scam. They offered 23K dong per USD, when you can walk 5 min down the street to a currency exchange or to another hotel and get 24K.

review.comment_positive: I am truly impressed by the outstanding service provided by this hotel. Despite booking at a cheaper rate, the level of care and attention to detail exceeded my expectations. During our stay, we unfortunately left behind a backpack at the hotel while departing for another city, Nha Trang. However, the hotel staff went above and beyond by promptly sending the parcel to our new location at their own expense. This act of kindness and exceptional service truly deserves recognition. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to everyone for its remarkable commitment to customer satisfaction. Thank you very much for making our stay memorable and for your exceptional service.

review.rating: Great location but very poor standard of accommodation.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive:
Location and the view from the room. 
That's about it.
review.comment_negative:
Was there for 3 days.Nobody cleaned our room once.house keeping would arrive at 9 or 10am and ask to clean before we left or were even awake and then never return despite our requests for fresh towels and water. 

Having asked reception numerous times for towels they still didn't arrive so just gave up.
The staff were practically hopeless and more interested in taking our money than doing their actual jobs on a basic level.

The room looked tired and old like the rest of the hotel. The photos do not reflect the condition. 
We had a delux room with a stunning view on the 9th floor but unfortunately we both felt that the price was not competitive considering a beachfront bungalow was cheaper.

No bar or even mention of what the hotel offered by the staff on arrival. Most every time we met them they were more occupied by their phone or were asleep at reception on the couch.

This being my third time in Phu Quoc ,I feel this hotel does not in any way reflect  Vietnamese hospitality and certainly not the quality of accommodation I've come expect for the price.

There's more issues I could mention like the broken shower, TV channels, lack of a second key card, no hot water lack of room lighting or decent room furniture, no room service  but it was pointless mentioning these to staff as they wouldn't get seen to. 

I couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone with it's current standards and lazy staff. Very poor indeed.
